description: Age as of last day of enrollment in benefit year
Age as of last day of enrollment in benefit year
Age as of last day of enrollment in benefit year

variable(s): Various HHS_HCC 0/1 markers, ICD10 diagnoses, and AGE_LAST
description: Include adults/children or infants having both completed pregnancy records and newborn records. "Bundled" claims should be separated into separate mother and infant claims whenever possible (as is described in the note at the end of Section II of the instructions document).

continuation.description: Infants with a record in the person-level file that cannot be matched with a claim or who do not have claims will have no diagnoses in the diagnosis-level file. All infants without diagnoses will be assigned to the lowest severity category and the Age 1 maturity category for infants as detailed in Table 8, rows 130 and 137.  Age 0 infants with diagnoses but who lack a newborn HCC will be assigned to the corresponding severity category and the Age 1 maturity category for infants as detailed in Table 8, rows 5-130 and 137.  Male infants will also have the male demographic factor assigned. Male age 0 infants who lack a newborn HCC will have their demographic factor reassigned to Age 1 as detailed in Table 8, row 142.
Beginning step of algorithm for including diagnoses for mother, if mother is the Enrollee on the bundled claim:
continuation.definition: if ( 2 <= AGE_LAST) and
(HHS_HCC207=1 or HHS_HCC208=1 or HHS_HCC209=1) and
(Enrollee has one or more ICD10 diagnoses corresponding to a newborn HCC in Table 3 {HHS_HCC242 or HHS_HCC243 or HHS_HCC244 or HHS_HCC245 or HHS_HCC246 or HHS_HCC247 or HHS_HCC248 or HHS_HCC249}

} ) then include the Enrollee and all HHS_HCCs that are valid for the mother (based on diagnoses that pass age/sex edits for the mother). Diagnoses that could apply to either the mother or the infant are assumed to apply to the mother.

continuation.description: Beginning step of algorithm for including diagnoses for infant, if infant is the Enrollee on the bundled claim:
continuation.definition: if ( 0 = AGE_LAST) and
(HHS_HCC242=1 or HHS_HCC243=1 or HHS_HCC244=1 or HHS_HCC245=1 or HHS_HCC246=1 or HHS_HCC247=1 or HHS_HCC248=1 or HHS_HCC249=1) and
(Enrollee has one or more ICD10 diagnoses corresponding to a completed pregnancy HCC in Table 3 {HHS_HCC207 or HHS_HCC208 or HHS_HCC209}

} ) then include the Enrollee and all HHS_HCCs that are valid for the infant (based on diagnoses that pass age/sex edits for the infant). Diagnoses that could apply to either the mother or the infant are assumed to apply to the infant.

description: Enrollee's enrollment duration in months in benefit year; used in Adult model to create 11 mutually-exclusive enrollment duration in months 0/1 markers (ED_1 through ED_11) that indicate partial year enrollment
definition:
Allowable values for ENROLDURATION are 1-12 based on months enrolled in plan in benefit year as defined by days:
1 = 1–31 days enrolled
2 = 32–62 days enrolled
3 = 63–92 days enrolled
4 = 93–123 days enrolled
5 = 124–153 days enrolled 
6 = 154–184 days enrolled 
7 = 185–214 days enrolled 
8 = 215–245 days enrolled
9 = 246–275 days enrolled
10 = 276–306 days enrolled
11 = 307–335 days enrolled
12 = 336–366 days enrolled.

description: Enrollee's enrollment duration in months in benefit year; enrollment duration is not applicable to Child and Infant models; variable ignored
definition: Allowable values for ENROLDURATION are 1-12 as described above.

description: Prescription Drug Categories (RXCs) based on prescription drugs in pharmacy claims in benefit year; used in Adult model only; RXCs 1-10 are variables; RXCs 1-10 are used in Adult risk score formula; RXCs 1-10 are used in creation of 13 RXC interaction variables; all 13 RXC interaction variables are used in Adult risk score formula
definition: See Table 6 for RXCs and RXC interactions. See Table 10a for RXC to National Drug Code (NDC) Crosswalk.  See Table 10b for RXC to Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) Crosswalk. See Table 11 for RXC Hierarchies.
METAL in {Platinum, Gold, Silver, Bronze, Catastrophic}

description: Enrollees (including enrollees in premium assistance Medicaid alternative plan) who qualify for cost-sharing reductions (CSR) are assigned CSR_INDICATOR values 1-13. Non-CSR recipients and enrollees with unknown CSR status are assigned CSR_INDICATOR value 0.
definition: CSR_INDICATOR = 1 for enrollees in 94% Actuarial Value (AV) Silver Plan Variation

continuation.definition: CSR_INDICATOR = 2 for enrollees in 87% AV Silver Plan Variation
CSR_INDICATOR = 3 for enrollees in 73% AV Silver Plan Variation
CSR_INDICATOR = 4 for enrollees in Zero Cost Sharing Plan Variation of Platinum Level Qualified Health Plan (QHP)
CSR_INDICATOR = 5 for enrollees in Zero Cost Sharing Plan Variation of Gold Level QHP
CSR_INDICATOR = 6 for enrollees in Zero Cost Sharing Plan Variation of Silver Level QHP
CSR_INDICATOR = 7 for enrollees in Zero Cost Sharing Plan Variation of Bronze Level QHP
CSR_INDICATOR = 8 for enrollees in Limited Cost Sharing Plan Variation of Platinum Level QHP
CSR_INDICATOR = 9 for enrollees in Limited Cost Sharing Plan Variation of Gold Level QHP
CSR_INDICATOR = 10 for enrollees in Limited Cost Sharing Plan Variation of Silver Level QHP
CSR_INDICATOR = 11 for enrollees in Limited Cost Sharing Plan Variation of Bronze Level QHP
CSR_INDICATOR = 12 for enrollees in Premium Assistance Medicaid Alternative Plan with 94% AV Silver Plan Variation
CSR_INDICATOR = 13 for enrollees in Premium Assistance Medicaid Alternative Plan with Zero Cost Sharing Plan Variation of Silver Level QHP
CSR_INDICATOR = 0 for non-CSR recipients and enrollees with unknown CSR status
